reviews.review_msg: Best prof I ever had and probably will have. So good that I made a review here for the first time. Has biweekly inclass quizes and activites for marks but they're easy if you do the reading and the textbook questions he sends out during the first week of class. Lectures are pretty much same as what's in the textbook and so is the midterm and final

Oops, previous rant should be about 221.  Took 280 by distance ed. He seemed scary on webct, but the live version is seriously high value. If you are not very bright or really lazy he might be too challenging. In tutorials he puts you on the spot, which cuts down on idiots babbling to get attendance points.Love it. Gourmet education. Four stars.

Space too small to say enough good things. Simply the best. Where are all the comments? I guess everyone is still speechless. A lot of thought and work went into every aspect of course delivery. Challenging, yes, but quite fair. Lively pace, almost an extreme sport at times. Imagine a class that makes you feel MORE alive? A+, Steven Brown!
good teacher
pepper! bring on the peppers!
great big chilli peppers!

Great Prof. Easily puts the most effort than any other Kin prof that I've ever had.  His "negative" comments are to help you and it's always constructive criticism. He's never rude. Great enthusiasm and great feedback on everything. Always available for help. His classes fill up quickly, so don't waste the opportunity. Overall, thumbs way up.

The last writer is the lame narco who created problems for all of us with the grading. This semester's distance ed course  was a ton of work. For Dr. Brown's part, he corrected our assignments and midterms in one day in all cases. He answered all questions in WebCT. I have no complaints about this course. The last writer is just a complainer.

Don't take his distance ed course for BioPsych. His instructions for the final exam: "study all 10 chapters in depth". It was a nightmare, he was snappy to the students online and did absolutely nothing to make the course manageable.

Although it is a 3hr lecture but time flies by! he gives out a million breaks and do in class activities that keeps you moving. The notes may seem slightly scattered at first, but everything will come together at the end. His midterm marking was tricky.

Very good prof! His powerpoint slides are very detailed and the exams are fair. He talks pretty fast but the powerpoint slides are all uploaded on WebCT, so you barely have to take notes in class (The slides are THAT good) Exams are mostly based on powerpoint slides and tutorial articles.
Great prof, made a class that could have been boring interesting.  Talks to fast but as long as you understand his slides you will do well on the exams.

i agree that sometimes he spoke too fast and was hard to understand. i don't think it's necessary to take psyc 201 before taking this class, as they explain everything really thoroughly in tutorials. i didn't and got over 98%. i felt pretty overwhelmed by this class at the beginning, but the exams were really fair and pretty easy.

i agree that he talked pretty fast and was sometimes hard to understand, but overall i think this class was done really well. i don't agree that you should take psyc 201 before this class, as i didnt and i got over 98 %, they explain everything really well in tutorials. i had karen as my ta, and she was a really great ta.

A good first effort. Explains the concepts thoroughly and clearly, but he speaks much faster than the 10 syllables/second average and combined with an echo-prone lecture hall, it's hard to understand him. Tests are fair except for an inordinate emphasis on research methods. Make sure you take 201 (as I did) before you take this class with him.

340 is easy, but absolutely  useless. Moreover, Brown is an ok teacher, but totally misleads the student in terms of what he is expecting - you think you are getting an A, when you get back a B. Very picky marker and only gives negative comments on exams.... he seems nice though, so watch your back! what an a$$!

Great prof: he's interested enough in what he's teaching that it can keep you interested, but not so interested that he's in a completely different world than his students.  Tutorials are invaluable: their learning curve is intense but not difficult, providing you've read the studies.  He's genuinely interested in helping you learn.  Recommended.

Really nice guy but talks waaaay too fast! Nobody can write anything down. Don't bother going to lecture just listen to the lec's online so that you can at least pause him. Good slides, but explanations can be really confusing. Be ready to memorize a lot of info!

Very well organized lecture, you'll miss a lot of material for skipping a class. Very interesting materials too, he give good examples. MUST READ ALL THE TEXT AND ATTEND ALL LECTURES if you want to be able to do well on ur midterms & final. However, I found thaat the exams were a little tricky, 80% on the 1 hour exam were short/long answers.

Stephen is awesome! His lectures were extremely organized and clear and he is really good with giving you some expamples that you should know for exams.
 Midterm 1 easy, Midterm 2 and final a bit tricky.
 Attend lectures and keep up with your reading. Im not a kines major. (engl here) but I really enjoyed this class with him. He's great!!!!

Definitely the worst lecturer I've had throughout my undergrad. He issued huge assignments without giving clear instructions as to what he expected. Grading schemes were made on the fly and the course content was useless.

Non-fence, but his lectures can be quite boring sometimes. I noticed a lot ppl who fall asleep in his class. Don't pay attention during lectures? No problem. He has excellent online slide show notes. Just highlight the important points, turn them into flash cards, and then MEMORIZE them. I did that, and I got quite a good mark.

Good course. Though this was the first time it was taught this way. Overall, enjoyable course and the prof is very understanding if you make an effort! The TA, Joanne Shum, was very helpful! Make sure to keep up with your assigned reading.

A fun and friendly prof, extremely organized and helpful. This course is given for the first time and basically its all about neuro-system. Class average was B, wasnt a hard course just need to memorize a lot of stuff about the brain.

the study guide was a good read, but the assignments demanded a lot of work and were somewhat confusing. stephen was the TA as well as the prof. he was a very critical marker and provided paragraphs of comments. this was the worst D.E. kines course i've ever taken.

first of all - HOT, always a plus. his TA was pretty cute too (Darryl); reaaaally nice and friendly, loves to chat with students, which makes it fun to attend classes; lectures were pretty straightforward, the topics were simple and easy to understand; exams, i thought were a little tricky, but managable

Great course with really interesting material ... assignments are super easy and straight forward. The midterm was fairly easy as well the final exam. But be ware, if you take this class via distance ed. (like I did) the tutor marker (Pooneh) SUCKS! very unhelpful and awfully rude !!!

I took this class via Dist. Ed, so I didn't actually get to sit through one of his lectures, although he did write the custom courseware (basically, our textbook) himself, and it was GREAT. Be careful if you take it Dist. Ed., though, cuz my TM (P. Afkari) was the wrost thing to happen to my university career. Rude, unhelpful, ridiculous marker.

I took this course with very little knowledge in bio-psych. But thanks to his great teaching style and skills, I ended up doing very well.  He is very passionate about the field he teaches, and his passion is contageous.  Helpful, kind, and FUNNY. Totally recommended.
nice guy.. not so good prof. incredibly unclear and messed grading scheme for final grades. I would not take 382 again...ever....

I'm gonna have to suggest not taking a course with Steven. He is a very nice guy and tries very hard to help students, but somehow it just doesn't work out that well. In any case, lectures are very disorganized (although slides are good) and the tests are soo bizarre. Fair marking but so hard to study for the tests because the course sucks.

He is a great prof, the course 382 was not made by him. It is originally taught by John Macdonald who is freakin jerk and only cares about his own research. Im so glad we have Steven instead of John. Cool guy

Steven is a good professor. He comes from the USA and is just new to SFU so I think it'll take some getting used to our school for him. But he is a really nice guy and is totally willing to help anyone that needs help. Very very fair marker. Sometimes he is a little unclear in his lecturing, but is very organized and has great powerpoint slides.

This guy is interesting !!! During one of our lectures recently, he had everyone come down to the front of lecture all, get in a circle, hold hands, and dance around with  a Romanian dance round and round and round.  He even had Romanian folk music to go with the dance !!!  A very smart and unique professor !!!!!
He is very shy and quiet.  His marking is fair, but his courses are challenging.  Don't take his class unless your brain can be stuffed full with lotsssssss of information.

He is very quiet, and would prefer to be with himself.  Not  a very social person.  He usually teaches very difficult courses, so  his lack of social skills can be a problem for students seeking further understanding.  Don't take his course unless you are smart enough to understand the material yourself.
Awesome awesome prof. totally fair and hepful. highly recommended.
I thought this class was very straight forward.  If you do the readings and listen during lecture you will do well.  Assignments are also super easy and marked very easy.

He is a super nice teacher and well in shape for his age.  He's the perfect prof for this course because he defintely cares about health (just look at him).  The course is pretty easy and not a lot of work.  A highly recommended elective.
Excellent teacher! The class was really interesting and his lectures were great!

He actually took the effort to remember the names of the students. Very helpful and enthusiastic.  Multiple breaks are great during a 2-hour lecture.  Assignments and exams are easy and fair as long as you read the text.

Absolutely fabulous!!! Best class that I've taken at SFU, and I'm not even a Kines major.  Steven is the eptiome of a professor who actually gives a**** about his students.  He's incredibly fair, and just overall a great prof.  Plus, he may be like 50+ but I still think he was hottie in his youth!
Very helpful, and very good at explaining physics based problems conceptually.  Tests were a little on the long side.
Very good prof.  Made ergonomics easy and applicable.  Lots of fun demonstrations.  Personable and well-liked by students.  What a silver fox!

Good guy, very personalable.  Extremely easy to do well if you follow along and basically know your stuff.  There is no trick to doing well.  The final was definitely more challenging than the midterms.  Be specific in your answers and you will do fine.

the "pink card" was excellent, getting a break for a 50mins class was generous!!! for an 8:30am class he wanted to make it exciting...his stories were a little to personal yet hilarious...assignments, presentation, midterm was easy...final was a bit harder than midterm but no big surprises!
This class is super easy and his assignments and exams are fair. Take this class for an easy A, it was my easiest A @ SFU!
His notes are very useful. I loved coming to class. His exams are soooo straight forward. I was glad that i took the course:)

He's nice but his tests are marked too hard... he needs u to have the EXACT wording as he has it so it's very hard... if you write something w/ a diff wording and even tho it means the SAME.. he doesnt' care... that's just unfair... but very funny
He's a prof who cares a lot for his students and makes the effort to make lectures interesting.  The "pink card" idea was pretty funny and his shirts haha.

I found him to be one of the best Profs I have ever had.  He would give big hints as to what would be on the exams, (i.e. "This would make a good exam question...)  He is very knowledgeable about his subject and really cares about his students.

I took this class by distance and found that the assignments were okay but the marking guide on his exams was absurd. Don't be surprised if you feel as if you have done well on an exam and when you get it back you have a C

i agree...his exams were very misleading and the marking scheme was awful...interesting lectures and stories but he wore the tightest shirts to show off his pecs...a good course though if you're interested in health and nutrition
Too picky about ever single nitty gritty detail. dont take this course if you dont have to

are you people on crack?!?! that was the most retarded, backwards class i have ever taken! i got A+s on all my written work and presentation, yet i got Cs on my midterms. hes all about the picky bloody details! avoid this guy like the plague!
Very interesting, genuinely nice guy, very concerned about well-being of students.. just had the BEST final ever!!
No Comments
No Comments
Interesting in Lecs, kinda misguides you for the tests
